relationships.description: 狮子匠造出怪物意图击败伤疤护民官
他如何通过他口中的银色梦境反复造访梦中的林地
林地生长于漫宿墙外
埃拉伽巴路斯是残阳的傀儡或化身
埃拉伽巴路斯最终寻见了纯白之门
巴尔多梅姬想要的是牡鹿之门
即便是冭阳也能被分裂，尽管它要求由㿟日铸炉动手
蚁母用她的两个头颅分别卫戍上下两方，若要通行，必须通过创口。我觉得纯白之门或许就是创口
所以我们视他作守夜人
所以我们视他作孪生子
所以我们视他作蚁母
所以我们视他作铸炉
所以我们视他作弧月
所以我们视他作昕旦
灵感源自受控之火
他们都穿过牡鹿之门
圣特里丰穿过双角之门
双角之门 likely associated with the Horned Axe, the Hour of the Knot
绳结姐妹会教喻集结成册，致圣特里丰的献礼
致圣宁法的献礼
寻求飞升以无情的光之司辰，瞳中扉的名义
唯有穿过牡鹿之门者才能获得第三印记。此人必须穿过林地
此人必须攀至纯白之门
双生巫女和林地司辰间的联系，特别是与其中一位名为丝毧的守密人的
致“寻找赤杯的帕西瓦尔爵士”
警醒风暴欢乐地从他的残躯中冲出，产床旁的助产士是山峦之母（赤杯）
山峦之母与警醒风暴间的长对话
一个身负伤疤的男人前来拽住喀俄涅的头发将她拖出城外（喀俄涅与白雪相关）
紫晶成虫是飞蛾的具名者，且飞蛾派她执行任务
我们已将马提亚斯逐出居屋
地图之疆仪式是浪游旅人给与我们的
他们向火而飞
他们向火而飞
紫晶成虫原先在与双生巫女玩耍
马提亚斯给我们下了一道挑战，要我们在林地里猎捕飞蛾麾下的具名者
他们学会了杯之欢愉
通过“玫瑰女巫”菲奥娜·艾尔郡接触了制花人之术
玫瑰女巫菲奥娜·艾尔郡传授制花人之术
教擂击者玩杂耍
梵咒可以让一个人将其灵魂献给守夜人
蚁母的神圣之门
兜颈贵胄穿过的门
纯白之礼是纪念司辰昕旦的仪式
昕旦执掌的自然是死亡和进入居屋的道路
海索将科赛利尖刻地描述成“蠕虫中的蠕虫”，并对其起疑
Kanishka betrayed Rook Kahului at the Spider's Door.
Kanishka was forced to serve the Centurion after his betrayal.
The Centurion is a Name of the Colonel.
The Forge loved the Sun-in-Splendour.
The Red Grail expected and prophesied the union of Forge and Sun.
The Red Grail expected and prophesied the union of Forge and Sun.
The Sisterhood of the Knot serves Ring-Yew.
The Sisterhood of the Knot serves the Horned Axe.
The Red Grail helped the Twins enter the Mansus via the River in the Paint.
Thunderskin loved Ring-Yew.
The Red Grail destroyed Thunderskin as compensation for the slaughter of Horned Axe's sibling.
The Horned Axe had a sibling who was slaughtered.
Thunderskin entered the Mansus through the Peacock Door.
The Crucible Prince serves the Burning Queen, i.e., the Forge of Days.
The Flayed One was a member of the Hooded Princes.
The Flayed One broke with the Hooded Princes and faced their wrath.
The Flayed One followed Thunderskin in endless dance.
The Hooded Princes pray to the Crossroad Twins (Witch-and-Sister).
The Hooded Princes begged the Mottled King (the Moth) to rise and devour Timur's army.
The Hooded Princes begged the Honey Tree to rise and devour Timur's army.
The Hooded Princes begged the Twins of the Sea (Witch-and-Sister) to rise and devour Timur's army.
The Hooded Princes sought help from the Keeper who dwells in a burrow (Mother of Ants), who provided blackmail material.
Alexander obtained the names of the blind god (the Colonel) and the sacred betrayal ritual.
Summoning the Crucible King may attract the attention of the Forge of Days, suggesting servitude.
The Ligeian Club has an understanding with the Bone Dove, using prayers to him in funeral rites.
The Scarred Captain was blessed by the snake goddess (Mother of Ants) after her rebirth.
The Scarred Captain went to the House above the Wood (the Mansus) and became supreme master.
The Forge of Days opened roads to the Mansus.
The Forge's first forbidden act gave birth to a spark that became the seed of the Flowermaker.
The Red Grail lured a great musician and rebirthed him as Thunderskin, a Heart Hour.
The Hooded Princes were originally children of the Mother of Ants.
The Hooded Princes waged war against the Forgetful Family.
The Vagabond (as the Centipede) led the Forgetful Family into danger and abandoned them; they never forgive.
The Golden General studied under the Scarred One (the Colonel) for seven years.
The Golden General became an enemy of the Colonel (Scarred Tribune).
The Endless Legion serves the Scarred Tribune (the Colonel).
The Colonel killed the Seven-Coils.
The Red Grail consumed the Tide.
The history of the Two Witches of the Dry Land is part of the Grail's torments.
The Shadowless Empire fought against an army of flat-necked snakes (the Hooded Princes).
The Invincible Sun Church worships the Sun-in-Splendour.
The church also honors the cold winter dawn (Madrugad).
The church also honors the setting sun (Sun-in-Rags).
The church also honors the arc-moon (Meniscate), the Sun's night self.
Their rituals include homage to the Red Grail.
Their rituals include homage to Ring-Yew.
Their rituals include homage to the Horned Axe.
Their rituals include homage to Thunderskin.
Their most important rituals are held at the Concursus, a room in the Mansus.
The Mother of Ants rose from the blood of the Seven-Coils after its death.
The Laughingthrush mask of the Vagabond was close friends with the Sun-in-Splendour.
The Vagabond (as the Centipede) cursed the city of Mua to drink only dust and vanish.
The city of Mua punished the Vagabond for crawling into the temple domain.
The bird-like Hours (including Vagabond as Laughingthrush and Bone Dove) meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The bird-like Hours meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The bird-like Hours meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The bird-like Hours meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The bird-like Hours meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The bird-like Hours meet on mountain peaks to exchange gossip.
The Moth usurped the Wheel from within and stole its skin.
The Forge of Days outshone and shattered the Flint.
Hocobold was a former member of the Forgetful Family.
Hocobold complains about being convicted by the Ligeian Club.
Hocobold uses Forge magic and claims it works better for nobles.
The Beachcomber meets with other bird Hours at the Perch.
The Vagabond (as Laughingthrush) meets with other bird Hours at the Perch.
The Bone Dove meets with other bird Hours at the Perch.
The Twins meet with other bird Hours at the Perch.
The Watchman was originally the Egg Unhatching, who fled into Glory and ascended.
The Vagabond has visited Nowhere.
The Vagabond has not yet visited Glory but will eventually.
The Forge of Days split the Sun-in-Splendour, causing his death.
Authored by Amira Za'ra.
Contains prophecy about the division of the Sun-in-Splendour.
Prophesied the division of the Sun-in-Splendour.
Authored by Jekadu.
Jekadu is one of the Hooded Princes.
The Hooded Princes originally came from the Fifth History.
Features Inam as a storyteller.
Features Kapigiginupil as a storyteller.
Features Galki as a storyteller.
Features Krepis as a storyteller.
Inam tells stories heard at the Roost.
Kapigiginupil tells stories heard at the Roost.
Galki tells stories heard at the Roost.
Krepis tells stories heard at the Roost.
The Beachcomber, as a bird Hour, gathers at the Roost.
The Beachcomber hides memories of secret couplings in the House.
Rumored affair between Ring-Yew and the Tree Mare (Sister of the Witch).
Kapigiginupil comments on the Beachcomber's thievery.
Kapigiginupil speculates about Ring-Yew's affair.
Kapigiginupil speculates about the Tree Mare's affair.
Ring-Yew is a woodland Hour, thus belongs to the Wood faction.
The Tree Mare is associated with trees, indicating the Witch-and-Sister's connection to Wood.
Beachcomber is a bird Hour, thus member of the Roost faction.
Authored by Finning Shun (or about his travels).
Visited the Mansus.
Crossed the Beach.
Challenged the heat of the sun's surface.
Dived into an underground sea lit by black jade.
Crossed the sea of twilight.
Spent his remaining days on a tranquil island.
Authored by Ning.
Features the Kitling.
Features the Snake Witch.
Features the Desiccated Witch.
The Snake Witch killed the Stag (Horned Axe).
The Desiccated Witch killed the Sow (Red Grail).
The Kitling performed a ritual to resurrect the Mole (Mother of Ants).
Contains story about the Stag (Horned Axe).
Contains story about the Sow (Red Grail).
Contains story about the Mole (Mother of Ants).
Authored by James Colin Murphy.
Authored by Nicole van der Leer.
Contains a story about the Red Mother (Red Grail).
Likely about reflections and mirrors, associated with the Meniscate.
About the foundations of the House (Mansus).
A book about the Twins (Witch-and-Sister).
Bears the emblem of the Knot sisterhood.
Bears the emblem of the Knot sisterhood.
Bears the emblem of the Knot sisterhood (though with a fourth leaf, the emblem is broken).
Scriptures of the Invincible Sun Church.
Originally from the library of a Red Long, indicating association with the Red Grail.
The book's title indicates it is about the Centipede.
Lady Yi demonstrated an entertainment that she claimed originated from this book.
Lock Cahully is the author of this account.
The account is about Kanishka before the Spider Door.
The account mentions the Spider Door.
Lock Cahully was a victim and lover of Kanishka.
Everett Vinzant copied the inscription from a cliff.
He copied the inscription from a cliff in Anatolia.
Christopher Larquebine claimed to have bought copies of this codex.
He acquired the copies from a witch family.
The witch family resided by the Marmara coast.
Hieronymus wrote this polemic.
The book criticizes the Knot Sisterhood.
Hieronymus belonged to the Church of the Unconquered Sun.
The Knot Sisterhood is described as having a corrupting influence on the church, implying opposition.
The Knot Sisterhood is a cult dedicated to the Knot faction Hours.
The Church of the Unconquered Sun worships the Solar Hours.
This codex is a document of the Knot Sisterhood.
Evan Morphy excavated this codex.
Books that mention the Hooded Princes often have confusing attributes like this one.
Ashley Phillips is listed as translator in a notorious translation, though the preface denies any translator.
Michael Blockley liked quoting this tantra.
C.G. Brill published excerpts of this tantra in a pamphlet.
The tantra was dictated by a mysterious figure known as the Flayed One.
The text describes habits of the mythical Nagas.
Alexander Sparrow's paranoid pamphlet heavily references this tantra.
Dafydd Jones claimed to own the only copy of this tantra.
Meredith Brien also claimed to own the only copy.
The two dueled over the book in 1840.
The sole known copy in Western Europe was stored in the British Library before its theft.
Harvey Hampton admitted to stealing the book from the British Library.
Harvey Hampton claimed to have eaten the book with butter and garlic.
Joey the Bridge, a retired soldier, wrote this epic.
The epic is about Alexander the Great's inexplicable retreat at Issus.
The retreat at Issus is a key event in the epic.
Lars Westergren, an explorer and murderer, wrote these diaries.
The Iron Book is a guidebook of the Limiae cult.
The Silver Book is a guidebook of the Limiae cult.
The Ivory Book is a guidebook of the Limiae cult.
The cult occupies a hidden enclave at the source of the Limia River.
'Brown' Joshua found the book in a well in Hamath.
He found the book in a well in the city of Hamath.
A legend claims Alexander the Great abandoned the book during his retreat from Issus.
Pavel Shuga collected and compiled this book.
The book records deeds of the Scarred Captain, an alias of the Colonel.
Alexander Probst restored a copy of this book.
Probst built upon the foundational work of Jay Vigo-Jensen.
A copy of the book was found in a temple in the mountains of Persia.
The Dark Gentleman is the only identified author of this work.
Brodenax signed this mystical text.
Keller wrote this Stoic poem.
The poem was written at the court of the Shadowless Kings.
William Midnight illustrated this book in the 1880s in Paris.
The book discusses the Nagas.
It is likely a translation of the 'Prophecy of the Nagas', though with differences.
The book is an allegorical history of the House of Lethe.
The book suggests the organization was inspired by the Centipede.
Alexander Pethens transcribed this book from annals in a hidden temple.
The book contains legends of the Shadowless Empire.
Pethens copied the text from annals in a hidden temple in Anatolia.
Yose, a priest and recluse, authored this work.
Cassius, a follower of St. Thomas, wrote this book.
Cassius was a member of the St. Thomas sect.
Menander the Victor is attributed as the playwright of this drama.
Maskell attempted to paint the torments described in the book, leading to his death.
Isaac of Kas wrote this history.
The book recounts the history of the Shadowless Empire.
The book records secret rites of the Church of the Unconquered Sun.
The Church of the Unconquered Sun is a Solar cult.
The book describes the death of the Hour Seven-Coils, also known as the Mother's Father.
Athena Vanna wrote this research notebook.
The notebook is a study of the wandering Hour, the Vagabond.
Ningal of Lagash authored this work.
The author is 'Child of the Grave', an anonymous Gaulish apprentice.
The author joined the Order of the River.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Horned Axe.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Seven-Coils.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Wheel.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Flint.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Egg Unhatching.
The book records the destruction of the Stone Gods, including the Tide.
The book records the destruction of the ancient Stone God, Seven-Coils.
Damion Azzanation, a disgraced oracle, compiled this work.
The stories in this book were passed by a blind white cat.
The stories were passed to Penelope of Gordion.
'Flaming' Omar wrote this during ascetic practice.
Mika Xi is the author of this damaged work.
The book discusses different origins of the secret gods, the Hours.
The book discusses the travels of the Vagabond.
The itinerant scholar Shaw Hei wrote this book.
Shaw Hei accompanies his discussion with a masked figure he calls the Beachcomber.
'Black' Ellie, leader of the Damascus Knot Sisterhood, ordered these secret teachings recorded.
The book contains secret teachings of the Knot Sisterhood.
Ellie Black was the leader of the Damascus Knot Sisterhood.
Emperor Didius Julianus imprisoned Ellie Black.
The emperor ordered the book buried with Ellie Black in an unmarked tomb.
Amira Zara prophesied the Intercalation.
The Intercalation is the splitting of the Sun-in-Splendour.
Jekadu is one of the Hooded Princes.
The Hooded Princes are from the Saint River valley.
Inam heard stories at the Roost.
Kapigiginupil heard stories at the Roost.
Garki heard stories at the Roost.
Krepis heard stories at the Roost.
The Beachcomber, as a bird Hour, gathers at the Roost.
The Bone Dove, as a bird Hour, gathers at the Roost.
The Vagabond (Roost) is a bird Hour and gathers at the Roost.
The Witch-and-Sister, as a bird Hour (Roost faction), gathers at the Roost.
Elagabalus is cursed by Janus.
His glowing skin bears the design of the Sun-in-Splendour.
Mentioned in relation to the Sun's design; possibly involved in stealing or saving from its plan.
Mentioned in relation to the Sun's design; possibly involved in stealing or saving from its plan.
Mentioned in relation to the Sun's design; possibly involved in stealing or saving from its plan.
Elagabalus rests in Emesa.
Elagabalus rests under the dome of the Church of the Sacred Girdle.
Sunset Celia is a Name of the Watchman.
Lady Tryphon is a Long of the Grail.
The author who appears as Sunset Celia claims to be of Elagabalus.
The author who appears as Lady Tryphon claims to be of Elagabalus.
The Glory is the pure light above the Mansus.
The Sun's plan was to enter, possess, or yield to the Glory.
Coseley received inspiration or direct assistance from The White.
Coseley was influenced by Hess's research.
Coseley was influenced by Rags's paintings.
The secret of the Shell is recorded on the walls of the Mansus.
Dragons turned into Worms after eating the corpses of Hours.
cc copied the writing from the walls of the Mansus.
The Suppression Bureau covered up evidence of Grisewood's atrocities.
Hagar is Queen of Shur.
Hagar is known as the Mother of Wolves, likely mother of the Wolf Divided.
Prophecy about using agents to avoid the fate that they cannot combine.
The Tide is sister of the Meniscate.
The Tide is lover of the Witch.
The Crown's members were chosen by Janus.
The Altar is Janus's judgment.
The Watchman and the Crown are in conflict; each would end the other if possible.
The Watchman's Tree is associated with the Watchman.
The Crown would end the Watchman's Tree if they could.
Janus is identified as the Watchman.
Janus is identified as the Twins.
Janus is identified as the Mother of Ants.
Janus is identified as the Forge.
Janus is identified as the Meniscate.
Janus is identified as the Madrugad.
Janus is said to be the Sun.
Roman priests knew the Dry Land and Elagabalus, implying connection.
Hesse had opinions on Janus.
Coseley had opinions on Janus.
Galmier wrote about Janus.
Coseley writes about the decline of the Shell through language.
The House of the Moon is likely the domain of the Meniscate.
In the allegorical story, the Serpent Witch kills the Stag, which likely represents the Horned Axe.
Moldy Warp is a Name of the Mother of Ants.
The charity 'New Ligeia' is named after Ligeians.
The phenomena described include worms, and the Ligeians are implicated in the sacrifices.
Peel discussed the Worms in his lectures.
The Great Worm event involved worms appearing in Paris.
Trowvane is a house located on the Border.
The Wheelock family are the custodians of Trowvane.
The Moon Hall likely has connections to the Meniscate.
The Triple Knot Sisterhood venerates the Red Grail.
The Triple Knot Sisterhood venerates the Malachite.
The Triple Knot Sisterhood venerates the Horned Axe.
The Triple Knot Sisterhood venerates the Thunderskin.
Coseley wrote letters to Hesse on memory.
Coseley supported the Worm faction.
Hesse supported the Bird faction.
The Worm faction and Bird faction are opposed political movements.
Warned of the splitting of the Sun.
Promised reunification at the Second Dawn.
Reunification will be through the preaching of Saint Perich.
Perich is the ink used by the Librarians; in some traditions, revered as a saint.
The Solar Church worships the Sun.
Harris was librarian at Hush House.
The Legion of the Doors protects the Border.
The Golden Wolf Corps protects the Border.
Both the Mansus and the city of Is have gates but no walls.
The Wood is a region of the Mansus.
Lionsmith captured the tears of the Forgotten Moon (likely Meniscate) to create pearls.
Noon Harbor is a sanctuary for Long.
Marinette acted under the command of the Red Grail.
When the Moth rose, Marinette consumed the holder of the Flaying Key.
Marinette consumed the holder of the Flaying Key.
The Vagabond visited Miah multiple times.
The Vagabond celebrated the establishment of the First Roost.
The First Roost is the gathering place of bird Hours.
Tirza Blake was the seventh librarian of Hush House.
Natalia Bruhlov was the fifth librarian of Hush House.
Janus is described as a trick of the Mansus.
The Unbuilt City is a concept related to the Mansus.
The Crown makes exceptions for the Library of the Watchman's Tree.
Spay compares Hooded Princes to Worms, linking them.
Nowhere Hours reside in Nowhere.
Mansus Hours reside in the Mansus.
Mansus Hours may exaggerate the threat of Nowhere Hours, indicating conflict.
Hooded Princes once served under Mother of Ants
Hooded Princes now serve Horned Axe
Lionsmith creates monsters to defeat the Colonel
Elagabalus is a puppet or incarnation of the Sun-in-Rags
The White is the Hour of the White Door; the White Door is associated with the White
Mother of Ants guards the upward and downward paths; the White Door may be the wound through which one must pass
The Forge of Days split the Sun-in-Splendour
The Colonel drags Chione (the White) out of Abydos, ending her reign of winter
The Horned Door is associated with the Horned Axe; Saint Tryphon passed through it to ascend
Saint Tryphon performed miracles in the name of the Mother of Mountains (Red Grail)
Saint Tryphon performed miracles in the name of the Opener (Horned Axe)
The Watchman is the guardian of the Stag Door; ascension in his name requires passing through it
The Madrugad presides over entry to the Mansus
Amethyst Imago is a Name of the Moth
Amethyst Imago played with the Witch-and-Sister
Matthias hunts Names of the Moth
Matthias devotes himself to the Forge of Days to ascend
Matthias and Amethyst Imago are lovers
The Obliviates expelled Matthias
Bancroft learned the arts of the Flowermaker from the Rose Witch
Bancroft knew an incantation to offer his soul to the Watchman for ascension
Fiona Elgin, the Rose Witch, serves the Flowermaker and teaches his arts
Mother of Mountains (Red Grail) and Wakeful Storm engage in a dialogue
Sir Percival seeks the Red Grail
The Serpent Gate (also called Spider Gate) is sacred to the Mother of Ants.
The Hooded Princes pass through the Serpent Gate.
Moth is closest to the Worms and knows their weaknesses.
The Lionsmith can defeat worms, though the method is not recommended for mortals.
The Centipede (a mask of the Vagabond) was punished in Miah, and her reaction was hard to bear both in the Mansus and Miah.
The Forge loved the Sun-in-Splendour.
The Red Grail had long anticipated the union of the Forge and the Sun.
The Red Grail had long anticipated the union of the Forge and the Sun.
Sisterhoods that serve Ring-Yew (part of the Sisterhood of the Knot) gave warnings and laments.
Sisterhoods that serve Horned Axe (part of the Sisterhood of the Knot) gave warnings and laments.
The Red Grail helped the Witch-and-Sister enter the Mansus via the River in the Paint.
The Witch-and-Sister discovered the River in the Paint and used it to enter the Mansus.
Thunderskin loved Ring-Yew.
The Red Grail destroyed Thunderskin as compensation for the destruction of Horned Axe's kin.
Thunderskin entered the Mansus through the Peacock Door.
The Invincible Sun Church criticizes and opposes the Sisterhood of the Knot.
The Sisterhood of the Knot serves Thunderskin (as one of the gods they venerate).
The Sisterhood of the Knot serves Ring-Yew.
The Sisterhood of the Knot serves the Red Grail (as one of the gods they venerate).
The Crucible Lord is a servant of the Forge (the Burning Queen).
The Forge (as the Burning Queen) shares a naked desire with the Sun-in-Splendour.
The Flayed One was once a member of the Hooded Princes.
The Flayed One followed Thunderskin in endless dance, thus serving him.
The Hooded Princes were angered by the Flayed One's actions.
The Sun-in-Splendour split, causing uncertainty in its passage through the Mansus.
A spell in the Watchful Tantra may show the way from the Hunter's Gate to the Serpent Gate (Spider's Door).
The Hooded Princes honor the Crossroads Twins, which are identified as the Witch-and-Sister.
The Hooded Princes begged the Striped King (Moth) for help against Timur's army; initially refused.
The Hooded Princes begged the Twins of the Sea (Witch-and-Sister) for help against Timur's army; initially refused.
The Hooded Princes begged the Honey Tree for help against Timur's army; initially refused.
The Hooded Princes sought help from the Secret-Keeper (Mother of Ants) and obtained blackmail material.
The Mother of Ants had leverage over the Striped King (Moth), enabling the Hooded Princes to secure his help.
The Mother of Ants had leverage over the Twins of the Sea (Witch-and-Sister), enabling the Hooded Princes to secure their help.
After coercion, the Striped King (Moth) and other forest gods helped destroy Timur's army.
After coercion, the Twins of the Sea (Witch-and-Sister) and other forest gods helped destroy Timur's army.
Alexander obtained several names of the Blind God (the Colonel) and a ritual of betrayal.
The Liminal Cult's Iron Book contains a prayer to summon the Crucible King for vengeance.
The Crucible King is associated with the Forge of Days; summoning may attract her attention.
Buzgash abandoned service to the Bone Dove to join the Liminal Cult.
Buzgash is a member of the Liminal Cult.
The Liminal Cult has an agreement with the Bone Dove, and they secretly pray to her.
The Witch-and-Sister have a connection to the Meniscate, the lunar Hour.
The Witch-and-Sister have a connection to the Velvet, a Wood Hour.
The Bone Dove preserves the memory of the Wheel, opposing the Hours' attempt to forget.
The Bone Dove preserves the memory of the Flint.
The Bone Dove preserves the memory of the Tide.
The Bone Dove preserves the memory of the Seven-Coils.
The Bone Dove preserves the memory of the Egg Unhatching.
The Watchman might be the only one who can forgive what happened to the Egg Unhatching.
The Forge of Days opened the way to the Mansus and transformed the past into present.
The Forge's first forbidden act gave birth to a spark that became the Flowermaker.
The Red Grail allowed the Witch-and-Sister to ascend.
The Red Grail lured a great musician and rebirthed him from blood as Thunderskin, a Heart Hour.
The Red Grail became jealous of the Witch-and-Sister's power.
The Hooded Princes were originally children of the Mother of Ants.
The Hooded Princes allied with the Mother of Ants.
The Forgetful Family cult was inspired by the Centipede (a mask of the Vagabond).
The Golden General studied under the Scarred One (the Colonel), serving him.
The Colonel slew the Seven-Coils in battle.
The Red Grail devoured the Tide.
The Legion of the Endless was directly commanded by the Scarred Tribune.
The Scarred Tribune and the Golden General are enemies.
The history of the two witches of the arid land (the Witch-and-Sister) is tied to the Red Grail.
The Invincible Sun Church worships the Sun-in-Splendour.
The Invincible Sun Church also venerates the Madrugad.
The Invincible Sun Church also venerates the Sun-in-Rags.
The Invincible Sun Church also venerates the Meniscate.
The Invincible Sun Church pays homage to the Red Grail during rituals.
The Invincible Sun Church pays homage to Ring-Yew during rituals.
The Invincible Sun Church pays homage to the Horned Axe during rituals.
The Invincible Sun Church pays homage to Thunderskin during rituals.
